00033 #include <assert.h>
00034 #include <string.h>
00035 #include "cparser.h"
00036 #include "cparser_priv.h"
00037 #include "cparser_fsm.h"
00038 
00039 #define INSERT_TOK_STK(t, ch)                           \
00040     (t)->buf[(t)->token_len] = (ch); (t)->token_len++
00041 #define DELETE_TOK_STK(t)                                               \
00042     (t)->token_len = ((t)->token_len ? (t)->token_len - 1 : 0) ;        \
00043     (t)->buf[(t)->token_len] = '\0';
00044 
00045 int
00046 cparser_match (const cparser_t *parser, const char *token, const int token_len,
00047                cparser_node_t *parent, cparser_node_t **match, int *is_complete)
00048 {
00049     int num_matches = 0, local_is_complete;
00050     cparser_node_t *child;
00051     cparser_result_t rc;
00052 
00053     assert(token && parent && match && is_complete);
00054     *match = NULL;
00055     *is_complete = 0;
00056     for (child = parent->children; NULL != child; child = child->sibling) {
00057         if (!NODE_USABLE(parser, child)) {
00058             continue;
00059         }
00060     local_is_complete = 0;
00061         rc = cparser_match_fn_tbl[child->type](token, token_len, child, 
00062                                                &local_is_complete);
00063         if (CPARSER_OK == rc) {
00064             num_matches++;
00065             /* 
00066              * Return only the highest priority match unless the lower 
00067              * priority match is complete and the higher one is only 
00068              * partially matched.
00069              */
00070             if (!(*match)) {
00071                 /* Return only the highest priority match */
00072                 *match = child;
00073                 *is_complete = local_is_complete;
00074             } else {
00075                 if (!(*is_complete) && local_is_complete) {
00076                     *match = child;
00077                     *is_complete = local_is_complete;
00078                 }
00079             }
00080         }
00081     }
00082 
00083 #ifdef SHORTEST_UNIQUE_KEYWORD
00084     /* 
00085      * There is a only one match and it is a keyword. Consider this a 
00086      * complete match.
00087      */
00088     if ((1 == num_matches) && (CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD == (*match)->type)) {
00089         *is_complete = 1;
00090     }
00091 #endif /* SHORTEST_UNIQUE_KEYWORD */
00092     return num_matches;
00093 }

00102 static void
00103 cparser_token_stack_reset (cparser_t *parser)
00104 {
00105     int n;
00106     cparser_token_t *token;
00107 
00108     assert(VALID_PARSER(parser));
00109     parser->last_good   = -1;
00110     parser->current_pos = 0;
00111     parser->token_tos   = 0;
00112     for (n = 0; n < CPARSER_MAX_NUM_TOKENS; n++) {
00113         token = &parser->tokens[n];
00114         token->begin_ptr = -1;
00115         token->token_len = 0;
00116         token->parent    = NULL;
00117         token->node      = NULL;
00118         memset(token->buf, 0, sizeof(token->buf));
00119     }
00120 }

00137 static cparser_state_t
00138 cparser_ws_erase (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00139 {
00140     cparser_token_t *token;
00141 
00142     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00143     if (parser->current_pos > 0) {
00144     *ch_processed = 1;
00145         parser->current_pos--;
00146         if (0 < parser->token_tos) {
00147             token = &parser->tokens[parser->token_tos-1];
00148             if (token->begin_ptr + token->token_len >= parser->current_pos) {
00149                 parser->cur_node = token->parent;
00150                 token->parent    = NULL;
00151 
00152                 /* Pop the token on top of the stack */
00153                 token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00154                 token->begin_ptr = -1;
00155                 token->token_len = 0;
00156                 token->parent    = NULL;
00157                 token->node      = NULL;
00158                 token->buf[0]    = '\0';
00159                 parser->token_tos--;
00160                 return CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN;
00161             }
00162     }
00163     } else {
00164     *ch_processed = 0;
00165     }
00166     return CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE;
00167 }
00168 
00182 static cparser_state_t
00183 cparser_ws_space (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00184 {
00185     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00186     *ch_processed = 1;
00187     return CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE;
00188 }
00189 
00204 static cparser_state_t
00205 cparser_ws_char (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00206 {
00207     cparser_node_t *match;
00208     int is_complete;
00209     cparser_token_t *token;
00210 
00211     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00212     *ch_processed = 1;
00213 
00214     if (!cparser_match(parser, &ch, 1, parser->cur_node, &match, &is_complete)) {
00215     return CPARSER_STATE_ERROR; /* no token match */
00216     }
00217 
00218     token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00219     token->begin_ptr = parser->current_pos;
00220 
00221     /* A valid token found. Add to token stack */
00222     INSERT_TOK_STK(token, ch);
00223     return CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN;
00224 }
00225 
00240 static cparser_state_t
00241 cparser_tok_erase (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00242 {
00243     cparser_token_t *token;
00244 
00245     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00246     token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00247     DELETE_TOK_STK(token);
00248     parser->current_pos--;
00249     *ch_processed = 1;
00250     if (!token->token_len) {
00251         token->begin_ptr = -1;
00252     return CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE;
00253     }
00254     return CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN;
00255 }
00256 
00271 static cparser_state_t
00272 cparser_tok_space (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00273 {
00274     cparser_node_t *match;
00275     int is_complete;
00276     cparser_token_t *token;
00277 
00278     assert(parser && (' ' == ch) && ch_processed);
00279     *ch_processed = 1;
00280     token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00281     if ((1 <= cparser_match(parser, token->buf, token->token_len, 
00282                             parser->cur_node, &match, &is_complete)) && 
00283     (is_complete)) {
00284         /* Save the parent node for this token and "close" the token */
00285         token->parent = parser->cur_node;
00286         token->node = match;
00287     token->buf[token->token_len] = '\0';
00288 
00289         /* Push it into the stack */
00290     parser->token_tos++;
00291     assert(CPARSER_MAX_NUM_TOKENS > parser->token_tos);
00292         token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00293         assert(-1 == token->begin_ptr);
00294         assert(0 == token->token_len);
00295         assert(NULL == token->parent);
00296 
00297         parser->cur_node = match;
00298 
00299     return CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE;
00300     }
00301     return CPARSER_STATE_ERROR;
00302 }
00303 
00317 static cparser_state_t
00318 cparser_tok_char (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00319 {
00320     cparser_node_t *match;
00321     int is_complete;
00322     cparser_token_t *token;
00323 
00324     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00325     *ch_processed = 1;
00326 
00327     token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00328     if (token->token_len < CPARSER_MAX_TOKEN_SIZE) {
00329         INSERT_TOK_STK(token, ch);
00330     } else {
00331         return CPARSER_STATE_ERROR;
00332     }
00333     if (!cparser_match(parser, token->buf, token->token_len, parser->cur_node, 
00334                        &match, &is_complete)) {
00335         DELETE_TOK_STK(token);
00336         return CPARSER_STATE_ERROR;
00337     }
00338 
00339     return CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN;
00340 }
00341 
00352 static cparser_state_t
00353 cparser_err_erase (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00354 {
00355     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00356     *ch_processed = 1;
00357     assert(0 < parser->current_pos); /* impossible to get to error state 
00358                                       * on an empty string.
00359                                       */
00360     parser->current_pos--;
00361     if ((parser->last_good + 1) == parser->current_pos) {
00362         cparser_token_t *token;
00363         token = CUR_TOKEN(parser);
00364         if (token->begin_ptr + token->token_len >= parser->current_pos) {
00365             return CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN;
00366         }
00367         return CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE;
00368     }
00369     return CPARSER_STATE_ERROR;
00370 }
00371 
00384 static cparser_state_t
00385 cparser_err_space (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00386 {
00387     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00388     *ch_processed = 1;
00389     return CPARSER_STATE_ERROR;
00390 }
00391 
00405 static cparser_state_t
00406 cparser_err_char (cparser_t *parser, const char ch, int *ch_processed)
00407 {
00408     assert(parser && ch_processed);
00409     *ch_processed = 1;
00410     return CPARSER_STATE_ERROR;
00411 }
00412 
00413 /* Define a table of function based on the (state, input type) */
00414 typedef cparser_state_t (*cparser_state_func)(cparser_t *parser, char ch, int *ch_processed);
00415 cparser_state_func cparser_state_func_tbl[CPARSER_MAX_STATES][3] = {
00416     { cparser_ws_erase,  cparser_ws_space,  cparser_ws_char }, 
00417     { cparser_tok_erase, cparser_tok_space, cparser_tok_char }, 
00418     { cparser_err_erase, cparser_err_space, cparser_err_char } };
00419 
00420 cparser_result_t 
00421 cparser_fsm_input (cparser_t *parser, char ch)
00422 {
00423     int input_type, ch_processed, n, m;
00424 
00425     assert((uint32_t)parser->state < CPARSER_MAX_STATES);
00426     /*
00427      * We classify the input into one of 3 classes: backspace (BS),
00428      * whitespace (SPC), regular characters (CHAR). We also check
00429      * if the buffer is empty when erasing or the buffer is full 
00430      * when inserting. A more systematic approach is to check
00431      * this in 9 state-input functions. But checking here reduces
00432      * the amount of code by a good amount.
00433      */
00434     if ((parser->cfg.ch_erase == ch) || (parser->cfg.ch_del == ch)) {
00435         /* 
00436          * Line buffer code already checks that there is character 
00437          * in token stack
00438          */
00439         assert(0 < parser->current_pos);
00440     input_type = 0;
00441     } else {
00442     if (parser->current_pos >= (CPARSER_MAX_LINE_SIZE-1)) {
00443         parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\a');
00444         return CPARSER_OK;
00445     }
00446     if (' ' == ch) {
00447         input_type = 1;
00448     } else {
00449         input_type = 2;
00450     }
00451     }
00452     ch_processed = 0;
00453     parser->state = 
00454     cparser_state_func_tbl[parser->state][input_type](parser, ch, 
00455                                                           &ch_processed);
00456 
00457     if (ch_processed) {
00458         if (0 != input_type) {
00459             parser->current_pos++;
00460         }
00461         if (CPARSER_STATE_ERROR != parser->state) {
00462             parser->last_good = parser->current_pos - 1;
00463         }
00464     }
00465 
00466     if (parser->cfg.flags & CPARSER_FLAGS_DEBUG) {
00467         parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\n');
00468 
00469         /* Print out the state */
00470         switch (parser->state) {
00471             case CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE:
00472             {
00473                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, "State: WHITESPACE\n");
00474                 break;
00475             }
00476             case CPARSER_STATE_TOKEN:
00477             {
00478                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, "State: TOKEN\n");
00479                 break;
00480             }
00481             case CPARSER_STATE_ERROR:
00482             {
00483                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, "State: ERROR\n");
00484                 break;
00485             }
00486             default:
00487                 parser->cfg.prints(parser, "State: UNKNOWN\n");
00488         }
00489 
00490         /* Print out the parser internal buffer and token stack */
00491         for (n = 0; n < parser->current_pos; n++) {
00492             parser->cfg.printc(parser, cparser_line_char(parser, n));
00493         }
00494         parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\n');
00495 
00496         for (n = 0; n <= parser->token_tos; n++) {
00497             parser->cfg.printc(parser, '[');
00498             for (m = 0; m <= parser->tokens[n].token_len; m++) {
00499                 parser->cfg.printc(parser, parser->tokens[n].buf[m]);
00500             }
00501             parser->cfg.printc(parser, ']');
00502             parser->cfg.printc(parser, '\n');
00503         }
00504 
00505         /* Print the line buffer again */
00506         cparser_line_print(parser, 1, 1);
00507     }
00508     return CPARSER_OK;
00509 }
00510 
00511 void
00512 cparser_fsm_reset (cparser_t *parser)
00513 {
00514     assert(VALID_PARSER(parser));
00515 
00516     cparser_token_stack_reset(parser);
00517     parser->cur_node = parser->root[parser->root_level];
00518     parser->state = CPARSER_STATE_WHITESPACE;
00519 }
